cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

cards.name: Benalish Knight
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavorText:
"We called them 'armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

cards.name: Combat Medic
cards.text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavorText:
"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. VI

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Freewind Falcon
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavorText:
"That does it! I'm going back to hunting chickens!"
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

cards.name: Icatian Javelineers
cards.text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.
{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: It deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

cards.name: Order of the White Shield
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: A shield of light admits no shadow.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavorText: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

cards.name: Pegasus Charger
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavorText:
"The clouds came alive and dove to the earth! Hooves flashed among the dark army, who fled before the spectacle of fury."
—*Song of All*, canto 211

cards.name: Pegasus Stampede
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.

cards.name: Sacred Mesa
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sacred Mesa unless you sacrifice a Pegasus.
{1}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.
cards.flavorText:
"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

rulings.text: It can be used during upkeep to create a Pegasus token in time for it to be sacrificed.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavorText: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavorText: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."
—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

rulings.text: Warrior’s Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won’t get the bonus.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavorText: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavorText:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavorText: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

cards.name: Cuombajj Witches
cards.text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to any target of an opponent's choice.

rulings.text: You choose which opponent chooses the second target. It doesn’t have to be the opponent who controls (or is) the first target.
Even though the opponent chooses a target, you control the ability. An opponent can’t target a creature they control with hexproof.

cards.name: Feast of the Unicorn
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
cards.flavorText:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

cards.name: Hymn to Tourach
cards.text: Target player discards two cards at random.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.name: Ihsan's Shade
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.flavorText:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

cards.name: Knight of Stromgald
cards.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball’s damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it’s cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade’s ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavorText:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

cards.name: Goblin Grenade
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a Goblin.
Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText:
"I don't suppose we could teach them to throw the cursed things?"
—Ivra Jursdotter

rulings.text: You can’t sacrifice more than one Goblin to get a greater effect.
Players can only respond once Goblin Grenade has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try and destroy the Goblin to prevent you from casting Goblin Grenade.
The Goblin you sacrifice to cast Goblin Grenade doesn’t have to be a creature. For example, you could sacrifice Boggart Shenanigans (a tribal enchantment with the subtype Goblin).

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavorText:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.
cards.flavorText: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin War Party is a card that references and creates Goblins, but it isn’t a Goblin card.

cards.name: Goblin Mutant
cards.text:
Trample
Goblin Mutant can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Goblin Mutant can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.

cards.name: Goblin Offensive
cards.text: Create X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavorText: They certainly are.

rulings.text: The tokens are named “Goblin” and are of creature type “Goblin”.

cards.name: Goblin Recruiter
cards.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards, reveal them, then shuffle and put those cards on top in any order.
cards.flavorText: "Next!"

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type “Summon Goblin” and “Summon Goblins” also count. You can’t search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don’t have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Snowman
cards.text:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.flavorText:
"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

cards.name: Goblin Tinkerer
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its mana value to Goblin Tinkerer.
cards.flavorText:
"Can they *do* that?"
—Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words

cards.name: Goblin Vandal
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Vandal attacks and isn't blocked, you may pay {R}. If you do, destroy target artifact defending player controls and Goblin Vandal assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: If the defending player controls no artifacts that you can target, the ability doesn’t go on the stack and you can’t pay {R}.

An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavorText:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. IV

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: "I got it! I got it! I—"

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it’s too late to activate its ability before it’s destroyed.

cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavorText: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Mogg Flunkies can’t attack alone, other attacking creatures don’t have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don’t have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

cards.name: Mogg Raider
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

cards.name: Pyrokinesis
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn’t resolve.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavorText:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

rulings.text: You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics’s targets become illegal, you can’t change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn’t dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can’t be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavorText: Charging alone takes uncommong daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.

cards.name: Uthden Troll
cards.text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
cards.flavorText:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere, Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavorText: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavorText:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender
cards.flavorText:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player’s creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Gorilla Chieftain
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
cards.flavorText:
"Oh, no—not *you* again?!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavorText:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."
—Virgil, *Aeneid*, Book I, trans. Dryden

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavorText:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

cards.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
cards.text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won’t affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavorText: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

cards.name: Spectral Bears
cards.text: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
cards.flavorText:
"I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

rulings.text: The checks for black cards is made both at the time you declare attackers and as the ability resolves. If there are any at the time attackers are declared, it won’t trigger at all. If there are any at the time it resolves, the ability will do nothing.

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Lady Orca
cards.flavorText:
"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."
—A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

cards.name: Ranger en-Vec
cards.text:
First strike
{G}: Regenerate Ranger en-Vec.
cards.flavorText:
"The path of least resistance will seldom lead you beyond your doorstep."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

cards.name: Aesthir Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.
cards.flavorText:
"A fine example of the rewards of artifice: a thoroughly obedient steed with wings of Soldevi steel."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavorText: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.

rulings.text: You draw a card and discard a card all while Jalum Tome’s ability is resolving. Nothing can happen in between, and no player can choose to take actions.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

rulings.text: You don't sacrifice Nevinyrral's Disk to activate its ability. It's destroyed as part of the ability's resolution if it's still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

cards.name: Serrated Arrows
cards.text:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.
{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you’ve somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Drifting Meadow
cards.text:
Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Pendelhaven
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old."
—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

rulings.text: The current power/toughness being 1/1 is a targeting requirement so it is checked when announcing and again right before resolving.

cards.name: Polluted Mire
cards.text:
Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Slippery Karst
cards.text:
Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Smoldering Crater
cards.text:
Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Strip Mine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.flavorText: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
